oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Tom T. Hall - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Lynn Anderson (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of September 05, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Tom T. Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Tom T. Hall Pulsebeat show -- (00:44) Spangler reflects on Tom T. Hall's military career; additionally, Hall reflects on why he chose music -- (01:31) Spangler reflects on how Hall wished to be a songwriter originally, and Hall reflects on the real life inspiration behind ""The Year That Clayton Delaney Died"" -- (02:52) The Year That Clayton Delaney Died (Tom T. Hall) -- (05:38) Spangler introduces Hall to reflect on his unforgettable meeting with Hurlyburly (unconfirmed) -- (07:38) Ravishing Ruby (Tom T. Hall) -- (09:56) Spangler performs an introduction to the commercial break -- (10:21) Spangler reflects on the multitude of awards Hall has won, and Hall reflects on his favorite award -- (11:18) Old Dogs, Children, and Watermelon Wine (Tom T. Hall) -- (15:10) Spangler has Hall reflect on his novel: 'The Laughing Man of Woodmont Cove' -- (16:21) Second Handed Flowers (Tom T. Hall) -- (19:04) Spangler praises Hall's humor; additionally, Hall discusses the complexities of life -- (20:32) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (20:45) Spagler asks Hall to make a song request -- (21:23) Understand Your Man (Johnny Cash) -- (23:51) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, kim; Hall, Tom T.;
